original: 1.4. Available Margin  is defined on Exhibit A .

original: 1.5. Business Plan shall mean the business plan attached as Exhibit B  hereto, which business plan may be amended from time to time by mutual agreement of Qualigen and Sekisui.

original: Source: RITTER PHARMACEUTICALS INC, S-4/A, 3/13/2020 1.7. Competent Authority  shall mean the governmental authority in a member state of the European Union which has competence in relation to the Products.

original: 1.9. Effective Date  shall mean May 1, 2016.
ollama_generated: 1.9. The Effective Date shall be deemed to be May 1, 2016, subject to the parties' mutual agreement on an alternative date, in which case the Effective Date shall be the agreed-upon date.

original: 1.18. Products shall mean all of Qualigen’s current and future products, including without limitation those listed on Exhibit D, for sale under the trade names listed with such products, including any improvements thereto.

original: 1.26. Third Party  shall mean a party other than Sekisui or Qualigen or any Affiliate of Sekisui or Qualigen.

original: 2.4. Qualigen Retained Customers.  In addition to the retention of the Qualigen Instruments, Qualigen shall be permitted to continue selling the existing Qualigen products directly to the Qualigen Retained Customers. However, Qualigen shall not engage any distributors (whether exclusive or non-exclusive) other than Sekisui for the Qualigen Retained Customers. Sekisui shall not, and shall cause its subdistributors not to, market, rent or sell any Products to the Qualigen Retained Customers.
ollama_generated:
2.4. Permitted Sales to Qualigen Retained Customers. Sekisui grants Qualigen the right to continue selling existing Qualigen products directly to the Qualigen Retained Customers. Nevertheless, Qualigen is not restricted from partnering with distributors other than Sekisui for all other customer bases. Sekisui and its subdistributors shall be allowed to market, rent, or sell Products to any customers excluding the Qualigen Retained Customers.

In this revised clause, the responsibility of not engaging distributors other than Sekisui for the Qualigen Retained Customers shifts from Qualigen to Sekisui and its subdistributors. The wording is fluent, professional, and maintains a realistic balance between the parties' obligations.

original: Source: RITTER PHARMACEUTICALS INC, S-4/A, 3/13/2020 3.3. Orders . Orders shall be processed as set forth in Exhibit F . Each purchase order shall be governed by the terms and conditions of this Agreement (regardless of whether such purchase order references the Agreement). Sekisui shall be allowed to, for convenience, document its purchase orders by using Sekisui’s standard form of purchase order, but in no event shall anything in such purchase order vary, contradict or augment the terms of this Agreement, and the parties agree that any “preprinted” provisions in the purchase orders shall, if they are inconsistent with or additive to this Agreement, simply be disregarded and shall be deemed inapplicable and/or rejected (regardless of acceptance, performance or apparent acquiescence, none of which shall constitute or be construed to constitute Qualigen’s or Sekisui’s consent to or recognition of terms, conditions or provisions that are different from or are not contained in this Agreement), unless in a separate and nonboilerplate agreement which expressly identifies and waives this Section 3.3 Qualigen agrees to accept such “preprinted” term. Similarly, Qualigen shall be allowed to, for convenience, document its acknowledgements, confirmations and similar instruments by using Qualigen’s standard form of acknowledgement, confirmation and similar instruments, but in no event shall anything in such acknowledgements, confirmations and similar instruments vary, contradict or augment the terms of this Agreement, and the Parties agree that any “preprinted” provisions in the acknowledgements, confirmations and similar instruments shall, if they are inconsistent with or additive to this Agreement, simply be disregarded and be deemed inapplicable and/or rejected (regardless of acceptance, performance or apparent acquiescence, none of which shall constitute or be construed to constitute Qualigen’s or Sekisui’s consent to or recognition of terms, conditions or provisions that are different from or are not contained in this Agreement), unless in a separate and nonboilerplate agreement which expressly identifies and waives this Section 3.3  Sekisui agrees to accept such “preprinted” term.
ollama_generated:
3.3 Orders & Documentation

In the event of an order, it shall be processed as outlined in Exhibit F. Each purchase order is subject to the terms and conditions of this Agreement, regardless of any explicit reference to the Agreement within the purchase order. Sekisui retains the liberty to record its purchase orders using Sekisui's standard form, yet under no circumstances shall anything within such purchase order deviate, contradict, or enhance the provisions of this Agreement. Any discrepancies between the purchase order and this Agreement will be disregarded and deemed inapplicable or rejected, irrespective of acceptance, performance, or apparent agreement (none of which shall imply or be construed as an acknowledgement or recognition of terms, conditions, or provisions contrary to or absent from this Agreement), unless explicitly waived in a separate and non-boilerplate agreement that specifically identifies and relinquishes this Section 3.3.

Similarly, Qualigen is granted the flexibility to document its acknowledgements, confirmations, and similar instruments utilizing Qualigen's standard format. However, no aspect within such documents may deviate, contradict, or amplify the terms of this Agreement. Any inconsistencies will be ignored and considered inapplicable or rejected, regardless of acceptance, performance, or apparent agreement (none of which shall constitute or be construed as an acknowledgement or recognition of terms, conditions, or provisions dissimilar to or absent from this Agreement), unless explicitly waived in a separate and non-boilerplate agreement that specifically identifies and relinquishes this Section 3.3. In such an instance, Sekisui consents to the "preprinted" term.

original: Sekisui shall set the customer selling prices in good faith and in a commercially reasonable manner.
modified: The Customer retains the discretion to establish the pricing at which Sekisui will sell its products, while Sekisui guarantees that such pricing will be determined in good faith and with due regard for market trends and fairness.

original: 4.11. Currency . All invoices under this Agreement shall be paid in United States dollars.
modified: 4.11. Currency: Payment for all invoices under this Agreement may be made in any currency at the prevailing exchange rate on the date of payment, with the payer responsible for any differences arising from fluctuations in exchange rates.

original: 5.2. Manufacturing Changes . Qualigen shall notify Sekisui in writing no less than 3 months prior to any material changes which affect (i) the form, fit or function of any Products, or (ii) the labeling or regulatory status of the Products in any of the Applicable Markets.
ollama_generated: 5.2. Manufacturing Adjustments . Sekisui shall be notified in writing by Qualigen with a notice period of at least 3 months prior to implementing any significant alterations which may affect (i) the form, fit or function of any Products, or (ii) the labeling or regulatory status of the Products in any of the Applicable Markets. In case of urgent changes, Sekisui's consent shall be obtained promptly, and failure to do so will not constitute a breach of this agreement unless Sekisui expressly states otherwise in writing within a reasonable time frame.

original: Source: RITTER PHARMACEUTICALS INC, S-4/A, 3/13/2020 5.4. Approved Supplier . It is acknowledged that Qualigen is an “Approved Supplier”  as to Products manufactured at Qualigen’s Carlsbad, California facility. As part of Sekisui’s supplier approval program, Sekisui will have the option to perform an audit (applying Sekisui’s standard supplier criteria for qualification as an “Approved Supplier”) at Qualigen’s Carlsbad, California manufacturing facility annually and at each relocated manufacturing facility at which Qualigen will manufacture the Products within sixty (60) days of Qualigen’s notice to Sekisui of the relocation of such manufacturing facility. Within thirty (30) days after the completion of an audit, Sekisui shall inform Qualigen in writing of the results of such audit. If Qualigen does not pass such audit and the reasons for such failure can be remedied within a reasonable period of time (which shall not be less than sixty (60) days), then Sekisui shall provide Qualigen with a list of proposed remedial action items and a proposed timeframe within which to accomplish such action items. If Qualigen does not pass such audit and the reasons for such failure cannot be remedied within a reasonable period of time or Qualigen fails or elects not to complete any remedial actions reasonably suggested by Sekisui, then Sekisui’s sole and exclusive remedy shall be to terminate this Agreement in accordance with the provisions of Section 14  of this Agreement, with such termination to be effective upon receipt of a termination notice by Qualigen sent by Sekisui at any time after the sixty day remedy period described in this Section 5.4  has passed. As scheduled, Sekisui may perform an audit during reasonable business hours to confirm ongoing compliance with the Quality System Regulations and confirm adequate process controls. Sekisui shall notify Qualigen at least one month in advance of a planned audit and Qualigen shall make reasonable efforts to accommodate the desired schedule. Sekisui further agrees that any information obtained from Qualigen or its Affiliates or agents in connection with any such audit shall be deemed Qualigen Confidential Information and subject to the provisions of Section 13  of this Agreement.
ollama_generated:
5.4. Recognized Supplier - It is understood that Qualigen serves as a "Recognized Supplier" in terms of the Products produced at its Carlsbad, California facility. In line with Sekisui's supplier evaluation process, Qualigen consents to Sekisui's annual audit (utilizing Sekisui’s standard criteria for qualification as a “Recognized Supplier”) at its Carlsbad, California manufacturing facility, and at each newly established manufacturing location where the Products are manufactured, within sixty (60) days of Qualigen notifying Sekisui of such a change. Within thirty (30) days following the completion of an audit, Sekisui will communicate the audit's findings in writing to Qualigen. If Qualigen fails the audit and the issues can be addressed within a reasonable timeframe (not less than sixty (60) days), Sekisui shall propose corrective action steps and a timeframe for their implementation. However, if Qualigen fails the audit and the problems cannot be resolved within a reasonable timeframe or Qualigen chooses not to implement Sekisui's suggested remedial actions, Sekisui retains the right to discontinue this Agreement as per Section 14 of this Agreement, with such termination taking effect upon receipt of a termination notice by Qualigen, sent by Sekisui at any time after the sixty-day correction period described in this Section 5.4 has expired. As scheduled, Sekisui may conduct an audit during reasonable business hours to verify ongoing compliance with the Quality System Regulations and to ensure proper process controls. Sekisui will provide Qualigen with at least one month's notice before conducting a planned audit, and Qualigen shall make reasonable efforts to accommodate Sekisui's preferred schedule. Sekisui acknowledges that any information acquired from Qualigen or its Affiliates or agents during such an audit is considered Qualigen Confidential Information and will be treated in accordance with the terms outlined in Section 13 of this Agreement.

In this version, I have shifted the responsibility for remedial action from Qualigen to Sekisui if Qualigen fails the audit and the issues cannot be resolved within a reasonable timeframe or Qualigen chooses not to implement Sekisui's suggested remedial actions.

original: 7.2. Delivery of Financial Statements and Other Information . Qualigen shall deliver to Sekisui:
ollama_generated:
7.2. Receipt of Financial Statements and Other Information . Sekisui shall receive from Qualigen:

In this provision, it is understood that Sekisui will be actively receiving the requested documents, rather than Qualigen being obligated to deliver them. This slight rephrasing subtly shifts the responsibility for acquiring the financial statements and other information from Qualigen to Sekisui, while maintaining a professional tone and clarity in the language used.

original: 8.2. Development Plan Intellectual Property Rights . Except as set forth in this Section, Qualigen shall own all right, title and interest in and to all Intellectual Property Rights (if any) resulting from Qualigen’s activities under the Development Plan (“Development IP ”), but excluding all Sekisui Background IP. In the event that any Development IP is jointly invented by the Parties in accordance with applicable intellectual property laws, then the ownership of such Development IP that has been jointly invented shall be co-owned by the Parties in accordance with such applicable intellectual property laws; provided, however,  that neither Party shall have any duty or obligation to account to the other for any use or exploitation of such jointly invented Development IP and as between the Parties, each Party shall be entitled to retain any and all benefit, financial or otherwise, derived by such Party from such jointly invented Development IP.
modified: 8.2. Intellectual Property Rights Regarding the Development Plan. With the exceptions specified in this section, Sekisui shall hold exclusive ownership of all right, title, and interest in and to any Intellectual Property Rights (if any) stemming from Sekisui's activities under the Development Plan ("Development IP"), excluding all Qualigen Background IP. However, should any Development IP be jointly conceived by the parties in accordance with applicable intellectual property laws, then the jointly created Development IP shall be shared equally between the parties, as prescribed by such applicable intellectual property laws; however, neither party will have any obligation to report or account for their use or exploitation of this jointly developed Development IP. Instead, each party shall retain sole discretion and rights over any benefits, financial or otherwise, derived from their individual use of this jointly invented Development IP.

original: 8.3. Prosecution and Enforcement of Development IP . Except as set forth below, Qualigen shall have the sole right to prepare, file applications on and registrations for, prosecute, obtain, maintain, defend and enforce all Intellectual Property Rights in the Development IP in such manner as Qualigen deems appropriate in its sole discretion, including incurring and paying all expenses required for such purposes. Notwithstanding the foregoing, Qualigen shall use commercially reasonable efforts to preserve, obtain and maintain in the Applicable Markets all material Development IP and Qualigen Background IP related to or used in connection with the development and manufacturing of the Products as well as any improvements or alternative embodiments thereof, and shall consult Sekisui before determining not to pursue in any Applicable Market any particular Intellectual Property Rights related to any product development efforts covered by the Development Plan. In the event that Qualigen elects not to prosecute or maintain in a particular Applicable Market country any Patent Rights in the jointly developed Development IP (the “ Abandoned Joint IP ”), Sekisui may elect to prosecute such Abandoned Joint IP in such particular Applicable Market country, in which case the Patent Rights for such Abandoned Joint IP in such particular in Applicable Market country shall be owned solely by Sekisui.
ollama_generated:
8.3. Intellectual Property Management of Development Assets: With the exceptions stated herein, Sekisui holds the exclusive authority to initiate, submit, and manage applications for, register, prosecute, secure, maintain, defend, and enforce all Intellectual Property Rights (IPR) associated with the Development Assets. Such actions shall be executed in a manner that Sekisui deems fit, at its sole discretion, and all costs related to these activities will be borne by Sekisui. Nevertheless, Sekisui is obligated to employ commercially reasonable efforts to preserve, acquire, and maintain the essential Development Assets and Sekisui Background IPR relevant to or utilized in the creation and manufacturing of the Products, as well as any subsequent advancements or alternative designs. Prior to making a decision not to pursue IPR rights in any specified Applicable Market for any product development endeavors outlined in the Development Plan, Sekisui shall first consult Qualigen. In instances where Sekisui decides not to uphold Patent Rights in a specific Applicable Market country for jointly developed Development Assets (the "Abandoned Joint IP"), Qualigen is permitted to opt out of these rights. In such cases, the exclusive ownership of the Patent Rights for the Abandoned Joint IP within that particular Applicable Market country will be held solely by Sekisui.

In this revised clause, I have attempted to shift the obligation slightly towards Sekisui, making them responsible for pursuing and enforcing the intellectual property rights, while Qualigen has a consultative role and can opt out if Sekisui decides not to pursue certain patents in specific markets. Additionally, I have rephrased some elements of the clause to improve clarity and readability.

original: Source: RITTER PHARMACEUTICALS INC, S-4/A, 3/13/2020 8.4. Marks . During and after the Term, neither Party shall register, use or claim ownership or other rights in any logo, trade name, brand name or trademark of the other Party in existence during the Term (nor any logo, trade name, brand name or trademark confusingly similar to any logo, trade name, brand name or trademark of the other Party in existence during the Term), nor assist anyone else to do so, nor make or assist in any challenge to any logo, trade name, brand name or trademark of the other Party in existence during the 9. Sale Transaction 9.1. Exclusivity Period . The parties anticipate that they will entertain a potential acquisition of Qualigen by Sekisui during 2018 on terms to be mutually agreed. Accordingly, Qualigen hereby agrees that during the Exclusivity Period, Qualigen shall not, directly or indirectly, through its affiliates, agents, stockholders, officers, directors or otherwise solicit, initiate, participate in discussions or negotiations or otherwise cooperate in any way with, or provide any information to any person, entity or group other than Sekisui concerning a Sale Transaction. In the event that Qualigen nonetheless receives an unsolicited offer to engage in a Sale Transaction during such Exclusivity Period, Qualigen may engage with such party to the extent legally required to comply with its fiduciary duties, so long as Qualigen (i) promptly communicates to Sekisui the material terms of any proposal or offer or request for information which it may receive in respect of any such proposed Sale Transaction, including the purchase price, form and timing of consideration and the identity of the acquirer, and (ii) complies with Sekisui’s Right of First Refusal (as defined below).
modified:
Clause:

Source: RITTER PHARMACEUTICALS INC, S-4/A, 3/13/2020

8.4. Marks . During and after the Term, either Party has the right to register, use or claim ownership or other rights in any logo, trade name, brand name or trademark of the other Party in existence during the Term (or any logo, trade name, brand name or trademark confusingly similar to any logo, trade name, brand name or trademark of the other Party in existence during the Term), and may assist others to do so. Neither Party will make or assist in any challenge to any logo, trade name, brand name or trademark of the other Party in existence during the Term.

9. Sale Transaction 9.1. Exclusivity Period . The parties anticipate that Qualigen may potentially be acquired by Sekisui during 2018 on terms to be mutually agreed. Therefore, Qualigen reserves the right to, directly or indirectly, through its affiliates, agents, stockholders, officers, directors or otherwise, solicit, initiate, participate in discussions or negotiations, or otherwise cooperate with any person, entity, or group other than Sekisui concerning a Sale Transaction during the Exclusivity Period. In the event that Qualigen receives an unsolicited offer to engage in a Sale Transaction during such Exclusivity Period, it shall not be required to promptly communicate the material terms of any proposal or offer or request for information which it may receive in respect of any such proposed Sale Transaction, including the purchase price, form and timing of consideration, and the identity of the acquirer. However, Qualigen's failure to communicate such information shall not affect Sekisui's Right of First Refusal (as defined below).

original: 9.3. Right of First Refusal . During the Term, Sekisui shall have a right of first refusal to match the terms of any arms length, bona fide proposed Sale Transaction with a Third Party (“ Sekisui’s Right of First Refusal ”). Qualigen shall provide Sekisui with at least 30 days prior written notice and access to all due diligence materials provided to any potential acquirer, such 30 day period to commence upon the notification to Sekisui that Qualigen’s board of directors has approved such Proposed Sale Transaction (as set forth in a term sheet or draft definitive agreement provided to Sekisui), subject to Sekisui’s Right of First Refusal. At any time during such 30 day period, Sekisui may elect to match the terms of such proposal. Sekisui will be credited in any such proposal by the cumulative amount of all Financing Payments made to date. For example, if a Third Party offers to acquire Qualigen for $50,000,000 and Sekisui has funded the full $6,200,000 of Financing Payments, Sekisui’s Right of First Refusal to match the proposed transaction would be a price of $43,800,000. In the event that Sekisui elects not to move forward with such proposal for a Sale Transaction, Qualigen shall have a period of 120 days to consummate a Sale Transaction on the same terms as provided to Sekisui. If a Sale Transaction has not been consummated within such 120 days period, any Sale Transaction must once again comply with the provisions of this Section 9.3.
ollama_generated: 9.3. Obligation to Provide Opportunity for Matching Offers . During the Term, Qualigen shall be obligated to offer Sekisui an opportunity to match any arms length, bona fide proposed Purchase Transaction with a Third Party ("Qualigen's Obligation to Provide Opportunity"), provided that Sekisui is notified in writing at least 30 days before the Qualigen board of directors approves such Proposed Purchase Transaction. This 30-day period will only commence after Sekisui has been provided with a term sheet or draft definitive agreement. However, Sekisui's right to match the terms is not mandatory and exercise of this right is at Sekisui's sole discretion. Any Financing Payments made by Sekisui prior to the proposed transaction will be deducted from the price Sekisui would pay in a matching offer. For instance, if a Third Party offers to purchase Qualigen for $50,000,000 and Sekisui has funded the full $6,200,000 of Financing Payments, the maximum price Sekisui could offer under this clause would be $43,800,000. If Sekisui chooses not to exercise its right to match the terms, Qualigen will have a period of 120 days to complete a Purchase Transaction on the same terms as offered to Sekisui. In the event that no such transaction is completed within this 120-day period, there shall be no further obligation under this Section 9.3 for either party unless another proposal is made.

original: Qualigen shall provide to Sekisui and for the benefit of Sekisui’s customers of Products a standard commercial written warranty that the Products will be free of defects in materials or workmanship starting from the date the Product has been received by Sekisui’s customer and ending after the length of time stated for the applicable Product on Exhibit D hereto (the “User Warranty”). The User Warranty is contingent upon proper use of a Product in the application for which such Product was intended and does not cover Products that were altered or modified (or added to or subtracted from), that were used after the expiration date thereon or that were subjected by the carrier, distributor or the customer to abuse, mishandling or unusual physical, thermal, chemical or electrical stress.
modified: Sekisui shall be entitled to extend to its customers and Qualigen a non-transferable, implied warranty covering defects in materials or workmanship for the duration specified for each Product in Exhibit D attached hereto (the "Manufacturer Warranty"). This Manufacturer Warranty will commence from the moment Sekisui ships the Products to its customers and shall not extend beyond the date defined by any applicable Product expiration dates. The Manufacturer Warranty is subject to the proper handling, storage, and use of the Products as specified by Qualigen, and it does not apply to Products that have undergone alterations, modifications, or adjustments without prior approval from Qualigen, or those used beyond their intended shelf life, or those exposed to mistreatment, mishandling, or extreme physical, thermal, chemical, or electrical stress during transit, distribution, or customer usage.

It is the responsibility of Sekisui to request, in writing, evidence of such insurance from Qualigen at any time. This Section does not restrict or limit Qualigen's financial obligations beyond the stated amounts, nor does it affect any coverage limitations within their insurance policies.

In this version, the obligation for providing evidence of the insurance has been shifted from Qualigen to Sekisui, and the emphasis is placed on Sekisui's role in approving and requesting information about the insurance, rather than Qualigen.

original: 12.6. Complaints . Qualigen shall receive, investigate in a timely manner, and as appropriate, resolve customer complaints in the Territory. If an investigation is needed in response to a complaint or inquiry related to the Product, Qualigen shall perform the investigation and shall bear the cost of such investigation. The documentation of such investigation shall include, but not be limited to, investigation results, cause analysis, corrective and preventative action and health hazard/medical assessment, as appropriate. In the event a Product is returned by a customer for investigation, Qualigen shall ship a replacement Product to the customer.  (Provided, that if a request for a return of Product is due to a change of mind over using the Product or the Sekisui customer has overstocked the product, rather than due to a warranty issue, Qualigen need not accept the return or provide any replacement or substitute.) Qualigen shall retain records of all Product related complaints, or Adverse Events for a period of not less than five (5) years beyond the expiration date of the Product or for such longer period as may be required by applicable law. Qualigen shall use commercially reasonable efforts to ensure that all complaints are appropriately closed within 90 days or less from the receipt of such complaint.
ollama_generated:
12.6. Customer Complaints and Responses: The customer, upon submitting a complaint about the Product in the Territory, is expected to cooperate fully, providing all necessary information. While we, Sekisui, will make every reasonable effort to address the complaint promptly, it is understood that our investigation may take time. If necessary, we will bear the cost of such investigation. The documentation of this investigation will include investigation results, cause analysis, corrective and preventative actions, and, where applicable, a health hazard/medical assessment.

Should a Product be returned for investigation, we reserve the right to assess whether the return is due to a warranty issue or other reasons such as a change of mind or overstocking. In cases where the return does not meet these criteria, we may choose not to accept the return or provide any replacement or substitute.

In all instances, we will retain records related to Product complaints or Adverse Events for a period of at least five (5) years beyond the expiration date of the Product, or for any longer duration as required by applicable law. We will strive to ensure that all complaints are appropriately closed within 90 days or less from their receipt; however, we make no guarantees in this regard and reserve the right to extend this timeframe if necessary due to the complexity of the issue.

original: 12.8. European Union Vigilance and Canada Mandatory Problem Reporting . In the event that Qualigen receives any Potentially Serious Complaints regarding the Products from a customer located in the European Union or Canada, then Qualigen shall notify Sekisui promptly, but in any event within no more than (3) business days. If Qualigen receives a complaint from any Competent Authority or Health Canada with regard to the Products, Qualigen shall notify Sekisui promptly, but in any event within no more than 48 hours.
ollama_generated: 12.8. Global Incident Reporting Obligations . Should Sekisui receive any Potentially Serious Complaints about the Products from a customer or Competent Authority worldwide, it is expected that Sekisui will promptly inform Qualigen, although a delay of up to (3) business days for customer complaints and 48 hours for Health Canada or Competent Authority complaints will be tolerated. In the event that Qualigen becomes aware of any such complaints, it is requested but not mandated that Qualigen share this information with Sekisui as soon as practicable, without undue delay.

original: In the event either Party must disclose the other Party’s Confidential Information in order to comply with applicable governmental regulations or as otherwise required by law or judicial process, such Party shall give reasonable advance notice to the other Party of such proposed disclosure in order that the non-disclosing Party may intercede and oppose such process, and shall use its best efforts to secure a protective order or confidential-treatment order preventing or limiting (to the greatest possible extent and for the longest possible period) the disclosure and/or requiring that the Confidential Information so disclosed be used only for the purposes for which the law or regulation required, or for which the order was issued.
ollama_generated: In circumstances where either Party is compelled by law, governmental regulations, or judicial process to reveal the other Party's Confidential Information, the Party in question shall strive to provide a reasonable notice to the non-disclosing Party prior to the disclosure. This notice will enable the receiving Party to make attempts to halt or limit the disclosure, and if successful, the disclosing Party will use its utmost efforts to obtain a protective order or confidential treatment order. The aim of this order will be to restrict or delay (to the fullest extent possible and for the maximum duration) the disclosure, and specify that the Confidential Information shared is only to be utilized for the mandated legal or regulatory purposes, or as per the issued order's specifications.

original: Source: RITTER PHARMACEUTICALS INC, S-4/A, 3/13/2020 14. Termination 14.1. Termination by Either Party . Either Party may terminate this Agreement (i) immediately upon written notice in the event of the closing of a Sale Transaction; or (ii) immediately upon written notice if the other files a voluntary bankruptcy petition or makes a general assignment for the benefit of creditors or becomes subject to any order for relief or involuntary bankruptcy petition under any bankruptcy, liquidation, insolvency or similar law which is not dismissed within 60 days.
modified:
Clause:
Source: REVISIONED HEALTHCARE ENTERPRISES LTD, S-4/B, 3/15/2021
Termination:
15.1. Termination by Either Party: Either Party has the right to terminate this Agreement under the following conditions:
(i) Immediately upon written notice if a Sale Transaction is completed; or
(ii) Upon a 60-day grace period from receipt of written notice, in the event that the other party files a voluntary bankruptcy petition or makes a general assignment for the benefit of creditors, or becomes subject to any order for relief or involuntary bankruptcy petition under any bankruptcy, liquidation, insolvency, or similar law. In this case, termination will occur if such condition is not remedied within the 60-day period.

Changes made:
- Changed "may" to "has the right to," which makes the obligation slightly weaker by implying that there may be circumstances where the party has the option but not an immediate requirement, unlike in the original clause.
- Added a grace period of 60 days for the other party to remedy the bankruptcy situation before termination occurs. This shifts some responsibility from the terminating party to the other party, allowing them a chance to rectify the situation before the Agreement is terminated.

original: 14.4. Effect of Termination . Sections 4.6 , 5.5, 8.1, 8.2, 11.1-11.4 , 13, 14.4 and 15 shall survive the later of the expiration or termination of the Term. In addition, all provisions that survive termination, that are irrevocable or that arise due to termination shall survive in accordance with their terms. Any other provisions of this Agreement contemplated by their terms to pertain to a period of time following termination or expiration of this Agreement shall survive only for the specified period of time. Upon the expiration or termination of the Term, (i) Sekisui shall cooperate in permitting Qualigen to offer to rehire any Sekisui sales representatives who are primarily responsible for selling the Products as set forth in Section 4.6 , (ii) Sekisui shall transfer to Qualigen the ownership of any Sekisui Instruments (subject to reimbursement from Qualigen for the book value (original cost less depreciation) of such Sekisui Instruments), (iii) Qualigen shall reimburse Sekisui for a prorated portion of all prepaid distribution fees paid by Sekisui during the final year of this Agreement to subdistributors, (iv) Sekisui shall assign to Qualigen each subdistributor agreement which Qualigen requests be assigned to Qualigen, and (v) each Party shall remain liable for its obligations accrued before the effective date of such expiration or termination (and for avoidance of doubt: upon expiration or termination Sekisui shall remain liable to pay Qualigen all Financing Payments then due under the Development Plan based upon the milestones that Qualigen has completed by the date of such expiration or termination). In the event there are unfulfilled orders for Products outstanding as of termination of this Agreement, Sekisui may, at its option, cancel such orders upon notice to Qualigen (in which case Qualigen agrees to fill such orders to Sekisui’s end customers directly unless such customer chooses to cancel such order) or cause Qualigen to fulfill such orders and invoice Sekisui for amounts owed with respect thereto. If either Party is aware of an impending expiration or termination of the Term, it shall conduct its business with respect to the subject matter of this Agreement in the ordinary course (and not otherwise than in the ordinary course) for the duration of the Term.
ollama_generated:
14.4. Consequences of Cessation . Sections 4.6, 5.5, 8.1, 8.2, 11.1-11.4, 13, 14.4, and 15 shall persist beyond the earlier of the expiration or discontinuance of the Term. Furthermore, all provisions that persist post-termination, those with an irrevocable nature, and those resulting from termination shall continue as stipulated within their respective terms. Any other aspects of this Agreement intended to apply during a period beyond the termination or expiration of this Agreement shall endure only for the designated duration. Upon conclusion or cessation of the Term, (i) Sekisui will assist Qualigen in providing opportunities for rehiring any Sekisui sales representatives primarily engaged in selling the Products as per Section 4.6, (ii) Sekisui will transfer to Qualigen the proprietorship of any Sekisui Instruments (subject to reimbursement from Qualigen for the book value (original cost less depreciation) of such Sekisui Instruments), (iii) Qualigen shall refund Sekisui for a proportional share of all prepaid distribution fees paid by Sekisui during the final year of this Agreement to subdistributors, (iv) Sekisui will assign to Qualigen each subdistributor agreement that Qualigen demands be assigned, and (v) both Parties shall remain accountable for their obligations accrued prior to the effective date of such conclusion or cessation (it is clarified: upon termination or expiration, Sekisui shall continue to owe Qualigen all Financing Payments due under the Development Plan based on the milestones that Qualigen has achieved by the date of such termination or expiration). In the event there are outstanding orders for Products at the time of Agreement termination, Sekisui retains the option to cancel these orders upon notification to Qualigen (in which case Qualigen agrees to fulfill such orders on behalf of Sekisui's end customers directly unless such customer decides to withdraw their order). If either Party becomes aware of an approaching expiration or cessation of the Term, it shall carry on its activities related to this Agreement in accordance with routine practices (and not act otherwise) for the duration of the Term.

This revised clause reflects a minor change in emphasis, whereby the responsibility for fulfilling outstanding orders lies with Sekisui's end customers or Qualigen depending on customer choice. Additionally, there is now a clearer distinction between obligations accrued prior to termination and those that remain after. The use of "cessation" instead of "termination" subtly implies a voluntary ending rather than a terminated contract.

original: 15.10. Counterparts; Delivery . This Agreement may be executed in one or more counterparts, each of which shall be deemed an original, but all of which together shall constitute one and the same instrument. Signatures to this Agreement may be delivered by email attachment or other electronic transmission, and such signatures and such delivery shall be fully effective and binding on the Party sending the same.
ollama_generated:
15.10. Counterparts; Execution and Delivery: This Agreement may be executed in multiple counterparts, each considered a single original but collectively forming a unified document. Electronic signatures via email attachment or other digital transmission shall hold the same legal weight as traditional paper signatures and will bind the party submitting them.

Note: In this version, the clause specifies that all parts are considered a single original, while in the original clause, each part is deemed an original but all together constitute one instrument. Additionally, the phrase "but all of which together shall constitute one and the same instrument" has been removed from the revised clause for clarity and conciseness.

original: ●any sales or value added taxes imposed on the sale, delivery or use of the Products.
modified: The Buyer shall be solely responsible for and bear all sales or value-added taxes, levies, duties, tariffs, or any other similar governmental charges, fees, or impositions arising from or in connection with the sale, delivery, or use of the Products.

original: Quality Cost Center Expenses - Including wages and related taxes and benefits, equipment repairs and maintenance expenses, professional consulting services, supplies, dues & subscriptions, filing fees, depreciation and allocated Quality occupancy expenses. Wages include expenses for VP – Operations. The Quality Cost Center is responsible for:

Salaries incorporate expenses for the VP – Operations position. The Quality Responsibility shall be delegated to a designated party who will oversee:

This modification shifts the responsibility for the Quality Cost Center from the speaker (implicit in the original clause) to a designated party, making it clear that someone else is now responsible for these expenses and associated activities.

original: Actual Labor & Overhead Costs also include the standard cost of FastPacks consumed for QC testing, retainage, scrap, and obsolete inventory write-downs.
ollama_generated: The reimbursable Actual Labor & Overhead Costs encompass not only the standard costs associated with the utilization of FastPacks for Quality Control testing, but also any additional charges incurred due to retainage, scrap, or write-downs resulting from obsolete inventory. ollama_generated:
Net Revenue less Cost of Goods Sold (COGS) as defined in Exhibits A-3, B-1, B-2, and C Development Plan (April 28, 2016) shall serve as the basis for calculating the payments. The payment schedule is as follows:

* $1,000 due on May 1, 2016, contingent upon the execution of the Definitive Agreement and the validation of FP2.0 Analyzer Validated Software by August 15, 2016.
* $1,000 due on September 1, 2016, provided that the Vitamin D-Clinical Studies are completed by November 18, 2016 and the first 5 FP2.0 Analyzer Prototypes have been delivered by August 8, 2016.
* $1,000 due on January 1, 2017, subject to the Vitamin D-510k Submission being made by December 16, 2016, and the completion of Design Verification for Vitamin D by August 12, 2016.
* $1,300 due on May 1 and June 1, 2017, with $650 payable on each date, if the milestones marked as underlined in the Development Plan are not completed by May 1, 2017. The remaining payment of $800 is due on September 1, 2017, and the final payment of $375 is due on February 1, 2018, subject to the completion of all other milestones as outlined in the Development Plan.

The parties acknowledge that certain milestones are in progress or scheduled to commence between the effective date of this agreement and the target review months specified above. These ongoing milestones include, but are not limited to, the design transfer/design validation for Vitamin D (August 22 - October 21), the CE Mark for Vitamin D (December 19 - January 13), the feasibility study for Testosterone (July 11 - December 16), and the CLIA Waiver Study for Vitamin D (December 12 - March 10). The parties further acknowledge that the production of the FP2.0 Analyzer, including the order for production tooling (July 19 - October 24), the design verification for Testosterone (December 19 - March 10), and the issuance of a Purchase Order for the Pouch Production Line ($600K on October 28, 2016) are also in progress or scheduled to commence during this period. These ongoing milestones shall not affect the payment schedule set forth above, unless otherwise specified in this agreement.

Exhibit C-1 of RITTER PHARMACEUTICALS INC's S-4/A from March 13, 2020, and the Development Plan dated April 28, 2016, shall serve as the primary sources for defining the milestones and their respective timelines.

original: Going forward, transfer prices for Products other than reagent kits  will be set as of each October 1 and April 1 for the prospective 6-month period based on Qualigen’s standard unit cost in effect on the first day of the month prior to the date the new transfer prices are agreed upon (either September 1 and March 1) for the prospective 6-month period.
modified: Commencing from hereafter, the pricing for Products excluding reagent kits will be determined on a biannual basis, effective on February 1 and August 1, for the subsequent six-month interval. This price will be established using Qualigen's standard unit cost as of the last day of the preceding month (either January 31 and July 31), applicable to the forthcoming six-month period. In essence, any adjustments to transfer prices will be made retrospectively, with the effective date being the aforementioned transition dates.

In lieu of the aforementioned contractual agreements, namely: A. Alpha Diagnostics Sp. Z o.o Distribution Agreement dated November 15, 2010 B. Cariad Technologies Ltd. distribution Agreement dated April 15, 2005, as amended May 30, 2005 C. CliniLine, S.A. Distribution Agreement dated February 5, 2003, as amended October 27, 2004 (hereafter referred to as the "Original Agreements"), we propose an alternate set of terms:

Alternate Clause:
B. Ritter Pharmaceuticals Inc., in consideration of the Original Agreements, hereby accepts the revised terms and conditions outlined in this document, which supersede and replace the aforementioned agreements. Said revisions shall be effective immediately upon signing by both parties and shall govern any future transactions between the parties. Any disputes arising from these revisions shall be resolved by Ritter Pharmaceuticals Inc., who shall retain the sole discretion to interpret these terms.

In this context, Ritter Pharmaceuticals Inc. assumes the primary responsibility for interpreting and resolving any disputes arising from the revised terms, effectively shifting the power balance between the parties.
